reviews.review_msg: i totally recommend her she is always willing to help and she is so encouraging too. yah this course does cover alot of material but what mbb course doesn't. her exams r not that bad as long as you know your material and study well.

Exams are fair, but make sure you read the text as you need to know a little more detail than the slides. Makes some errors in lecture that are only caught much later so it can mess up how u memorize things. I think she is one of the easier profs that we could have got for 221

I think she's nice but not a good prof at all.  She expects you to know so much detail about all the slides she shows in lecture and she is not prepared when she comes to class. Her tests are pretty hard.
Terrible prof. Seems to want students to do poorly. Seems nice at first, but all exams are unfair, testing small, insignificant details that do not test your actual comprehension of the course.

scott is a very helpful prof he is very precise about what he covers/puts on and notes which u shud kno damn well cuz he likes to surprise u with tiny details very much on the exams.well i ended up with an A- and personaly what i did to help me was that i tried to stay caught up with the lectures n UNDERSTAND wut u read

Never take her course, at least her MBB221!!!She is boring and her notes are pointless. She just pastes the whole text into her powerpoint with adding useless information and deleting imprtant details, which makes the note even make less sense. Even when I did some preview, she could mess me up in her lecture, so I had to study again all by myself.

She is a very irresponsible prof. I tried emailing her and she just doesn't respond. Additionally her exam questions are very incomprehensible, and ambiguous. They're long and tedious. You can always be certain you'll run out of time when you write her exams.
She is NOT Funny.  Gives us learning objectives, but she needs teaching objectives.  Terrible, terrible, terrible prof.  I will delay my degree if she is teaching a class that I need.

She was very disorganized and had very poor wording in her exam questions and lecture notes. Since the textbook is incredibly detailed and quite overwhelming, take good notes in class because her exam questions come straight from class discussion. There's a lot of material in this course and it's a good one, but wait for a different prof.

Incredibly disorganized, very unclear with EVERY concept explained. The worst part of this prof is she can't make up exams. Questions were asked in a manner that is most confusing. Complete crap questions compounded with incredibly long exams equal nobody finishing. Heed the warning...avoid at all costs...

Knows the subject but terrible at teaching it. Materials are based on different texts but only tells you to read the most useless one for clarification. Impossible office hour. Ambiguous standards vary from exam to exam. The pace and quality of the lectures vary, depending on how much time is available before each exam. Try to avoid her class.

She just doesn't know what she's doing.  Her lectures aren't too bad if you get used to it, but it's better to read the text instead.  For her tests, she looks for speciific details instead of general understanding on the major concepts.  Just dun take her courses, ever.
This person doesn't know how to teach, her lectures and notes are simply useless. Take her course and you will know why she is rated with a sad face.

provides unclear notes mainly consisting of pictures, has awful writing that is difficult to read. tests do not cover most of the material that is in the required readings. very unhelpful. the course material is interesting when you read the book but lecture is awful. wait for another teacher before taking this class.
She is a slow-talking prof, enough to bore you to tears. pretty clear on her lectures, but once exam time comes, everything she taught ISN'T on the test.Unhelpful. Really short, too.
Interesting, prepared, really made an effort to help us learn.

Great professor.  Her exams are fairly easy if you study her notes and understand them well. She's a little intimidating because she knows so much so I feel so dumb asking questions.  High energy lectures. Prof who really loves what she's doing. Definitely recommend her for all classes! One of my favorite prof!

For a biochemist she knows very little about basic chemistry, and often contradicts herself in her notes.  Overall good energy, seems interested in the subject.  Tests were very fair and well-marked and she is VERY eager to help out anyone who ventures into her inconveniently timed office hours.

to those of you who complain that she is not helpful/is mean/fill-in-the-blank notes, etc. be GRATEFUL!!! she's very clear and at least the note copying keeps you awake. wait till you get Kovalyova (and her monotone) for mbb 222...THEN you'll learn to appreciate Hawkins.
No Comments

shes an alright prof. her tests are pretty fair and straight from her notes. the course only sucks cuz there is WAY too much material. MEMORIZING her notes and those relevant sections in the txtbook is the key to do well in this class.

she knows how to read out the book word by word, that's as good as her teaching goes,cut and paste 90% of the pix from text, and you gotta know everything there on. Tells people to line up and listen their names to be announced when handing back tests in a 300 person class.weird & unpleasent teacher

Tries to come off as approachable but is actually who a huge psycho, who says stuff like "Clathrin is cool" and "Look at these beautiful coil-coil motifs!" Her notes are a tad batty and don't make sense unless you pay the utmost attention in class and follow the text.

very clear explanations in class, good talking speed - and good lecture notes. a lot of reading though (not her fault-it's the course) ...but she always puts up her lecture notes online the LAST minute!!!

I think it's the course material that's hard, not the prof. All I can say is she is quite approachable. Go to her office at least once a week with questions about notes. Sometimes she gets into a discussion that is very helpful on exams.
No Comments
Exams are all about the lecture powerpoints.  Read them, memorize them.  There is a large volume of info to memorize, but its doable.
Tries her best to make it not boring: no mic, shouts, waves arms. Very clear. It's the sheer vol. of stuff to mememorise that kills you. Tests are fair (comp to other 221)
she consistantly puts me to sleep. her voice is annoying and her lectures are boring and unprepared.
Explainations for course content are ok....notes are directly from the text book; almost word by word, extream hardcore exams....not objective, but rather  too  comprehensive!!
SOME PEOPLE ARE NOT MADE FOR TEACHING!
She basically reads lecture notes in the class. Pretends to be nice, but when you actually deal with her face to face she is very unpleasant.
The most boring teacher I have seen. Lectures are torture. She makes an un-welcome face and stops smiling when you approach her to ask a question.
No Comments
No Comments

Amazing prof, very helpful and approachable.  No assignments due, just midterms/final.  Include adequate detail in your answers and seek extra help if you need it and you will do well.  Overall a very interesting class and relevant to future kin classes (kin 205, 305, 306) if you're a kin major.

Dr.Moore~ One of the best profs ever! She's well-organised, warm, and professional. Read the text, go to the classes, never miss the tutorials, seek for extra help, then you will ace what u want. This prof- made me want to major in MBB.

Work hard in this class and seek extra help when you don't understand something and you will succeed.  She is very approachable and friendly and willing to help.  Exams are fair but make sure you include lots of detail in your answers.  Study the notes and you're fine.

Study her notes very well and u'll do fine...consult the textbook if you encounter any problems along the way.Pleasant teacher to have. Lectures may kind of be boring, but it is more enjoyable than just seating there and listening to prof. talk.

lots of memorizing !!!!!
 
 Exams are tough .....and your answers should have exact words as in her notes. Her notes are good. But you really have to work very hard...from the first lecture to get marks on her midterms.

Well her notes are pretty good. I never had to open the textbook becuz it was all in her notes. The midterms and final was fair. Just a lot of memorizing and spitting it out exactly the way she wanted it.
Very good prof, she had the best lecture notes in my university career so far. Also very approachable and friendly.

On the whole I am not a fan of her. She rambles on and on, non stop during her lectures, giving out 'half-notes' that you spend so much time copying that you don't have time to listen to her. Sounds like a nagging mother and didn't scale our class' marks.
she's very helpful.ll do well if u memorize her notes only.
She is a really good prof..wheah...
